alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 1:37PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...An intense lake effect snow band will affect western Cuyahoga County Until 300 PM EST.... At 135 PM EST, radar indicated an intense lake effect snow band along a line extending from 21 miles north of Lakewood to near Avon Lake to near Olmsted Falls, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Visibility rapidly dropping to less than a quarter of a mile... Up to 1 inch of quick snow accumulation... Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Parma, Lakewood, Strongsville, Westlake, North Royalton, North Olmsted, Parma Heights, Rocky River, Broadview Heights, Brook Park, Berea, Fairview Park, Middleburg Heights, Bay Village, Brooklyn, Olmsted Falls and Linndale. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/cle and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. && ODOT DMS 302, 303, 309, 310, and 321.
